column1: “The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking.”
column2: “The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking.”

column1: “It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.”
column2: “It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.”

column1: “There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.”
column2: “There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.”

column1: “The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid.”
column2: “The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid.”

column1: “Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.”
column2: “Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.”

column1: “Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value.”
column2: “Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value.”

column1: “It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not.”
column2: “It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not.”

column1: “I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.”
column2: “I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.”

column1: “A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water.”
column2: “A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water.”

column1: “A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.”
column2: “A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.”
